newsitem.title: USA: Northwest says restores Wash natgas lines.
newsitem.headline: Northwest says restores Wash natgas lines.

text.p: Northwest Pipeline Corp said Wednesday it has completed repairs to the two sections of its 26-inch natural gas pipeline that ruptured last weekend in western Washington.
"The line near Kalama was back in service at 10:28 PM (MST) last night, and the line near Everson was back at 5:00 AM (MST) today," company spokesman John Nicksich said.
The line near Everson ruptured on Feb 8, while the rupture on the line near Kalama occurred the following day. No injuries were reported in either incident.
Following the explosions, Northwest switched service to a parallel, 30-inch diameter line to avoid curtailing any deliveries to local customers.
The cause of the ruptures is still not known, but Northwest said it is working with the U.S. Department of Transportation Office of Pipeline Safety and state agencies to better determine this.
The Northwest Pipeline system runs from the San Juan Basin in northwestern New Mexico to the U.S.-Canadian border at Sumas, Wash.
Northwest Pipeline is a unit of the Williams Cos.
